On june 30, 2014
hottest

Welcome to Die2Nite Questions and Answers thread, a Q&A which is open to everyone, resident or hero.
Unlike the help, discussion and saloon forums which residents are not granted access and being looked down upon, we like residents. Residents rock! And yes, Resident-ism sucks!

Feel free to ask any question. No question is silly.
The only silly question is the one you don't ask.
Be polite, nice and respect each other.
Please use this format when you ask a question:

[Person who asks]
Q1: Hello, will I die if I sleep while dehydrated?

[Person who answers]
A1: Hi! Yes you will.

[Person who asks any follow-up]
#1: Will I die too even if I'm refreshed while dehydrated?

[Person who answers again]
#1: Yes you will. It does not matter.


Enjoy! Don't die2nite!

On june 30, 2014
hottest
Fatality

Dear hottest & co,
Q3: When do rare bps from camping in buildings start popping up?

I heard it was 11ap & onwards but i had camped at an 11ap building and still got an uncommon blueprint.Is this theory falsified or truthsilifictionizalled, and is there an exact number or is it 'the further away the more likely to get rare bp rule'?

A3: The rule is simple.

It depends on the km (not the ap) of the campsite.

You get a uncommon blueprint for any campsite which is within 9km or below (inclusive).
Otherwise you get a rare blueprint.

lStealtherl

Q5

I just stumbled upon this sentence in wiki page about scavenging:
Exploring Ruins will not interrupt your timer if you are auto-searching the zone in which it is located. Buildings also get depleted but yield nothing after becoming depleted.
Does that mean I shouldn't auto-search the ruin (at all?) and leave it be for all other players to use the Explore-button? To get those "special" items than those in deserts?

So far I've checked what item I got, and it's nothing close to motorway services loot-drop.

I always assumed that with auto-search, it's eqvuialent to "explore-button" every 2 hours until it gets depleted.
On july 1, 2014
Miudo
Tha dance of the ducks

A5
They are 2 separated things. You can visit a depleted zone with a ruin and still Explore it for items (asuming the ruin is not depleted yet).

Items found while auto-searching on a zone with a ruin (or neighbour zones) are not related to the ruin itself.

Also related:
A Hero Scavenger will sense a depleted zone with a Undepleted Ruin as Undepleted zone too.

Exploring an Explorable Ruin (the one with mini-game) WILL stop your auto-search counter in that zone. ItÂ´s better to search the zone after you entered the ruin.

A6
According to...spits... Map Viewer Construction page. If you select all buildings you will see:

Twisted Plank Twisted Plank x 442
Wrought Iron Wrought Iron x 422
Patchwork Beam Patchwork Beam x 464
Metal Support Metal Support x 431

... a bit more needs on wood.

But if you put Home upgrades into that:

Shack x 40 planks (1 each)
House x 40 irons (1 each)
Safehouse x 80 irons (2 each), 120 planks (3 each)
Stronghold x 120 planks (3 each), x160 irons (4 each)
Nuclear Bunker x80 irons (2 each)
Palace x400 iron (10 each), x200 planks (5 each)

Iron takes the lead. Not mentioning it is needed for other items too. ( and I know we would never get 40 Palaces..., its just to ilustrate)

Why is it like that? I dunno.

A27: The guitar adds one AP to anyone who has less than maximum AP, or 2 if they are drunk or drugged (effects do not stack) up to a maximum of... maximum AP. FatalityQ28 Small town map zoo

A28 This was answered in the forum

To avoid Zoo respawn:

2 x mapWidth x dayNumber >= zombiesAliveNumber

Small Map = 13x13

Distant Map = 27x27

So, apparently, it is:

SmallMap = 2 x 13 x dayNo (26,52,78,104,130,156,182,208...)
DistantMap = 2 x 27 x dayNo (54,108,162,216,270,324,378,432...)


Could someone please confirm this ?

FatalityQ28
small town map zoo
no. of zombies requirement?(stupid zombie respawn )

A28
In my opinion, I believe small map shares the same zombie respawn threshold as normal maps.
It is 28 * Day for all map types.
Note though it is just a formula which is proved to be safe without triggering global respawn. No one really wants the exact formula except MT.
It is still possible to go a bit down.
If you want to be more aggressive, 27 * Day, or even 26 * Day.

Another theory is the threshold depends on the width of the map.
Small map: Map width * 2 * Day
Distant/Hardcore map: Map width * Day


FatalityQ33
Is watchman chance of survival based on cumulative nights or is it accumulative no. of days as a watchman?

A33
Consecutive nights.
Each additional night is -5% survival chance as a penalty.
If you break the row, the penalty will be removed.

Question 3436:

Is the siesta time (level 2) worth building in a random town?

Question 3537:

Someone messed up the numbering (I will blame tibe33 ).
And since those old questions haven't been answered yet.
Let's change them to Q36 and Q37.

A36
No. It has initial build cost.
The return is slow. It is only worth in the long run.
Random town does not last long. It isn't worth it.

A37
Siesta Time can be good in organized towns, depending on your strategy and how you make use of it.
If you want to build, you want your heroes to build as soon as practically possible.
You need to organize the list of heroes who are going to build Siesta Time.

If you upgrade Siesta Time to Level 3, it is almost certain you can get the bonus AP, taking you to 7AP every day.
However it costs a Mattress, so only a few could afford it.

kiwiluke

42: yes it is, will try to explain more with answers to next questions

43: the only possible exploit to this is a gradual rise to 100 soul points and entry to distant/hardcore towns, but it is much quicker if you keep yourself alive

44: This is false, zombies do not spawn on chests, they do sometimes spawn in random zones with no building (and possibly a chest) causing false positives when scouting for buildings

45: spread is when zombies multiply out from already infested zones, spawning is what happens at start of town or when you kill too many zombies causing a respawn

46: yes killing enough will cancel out the effect of the spread, the exact numbers needed i will leave to others rather than possible spread false figures

47: i will leave this question as i don't have figures for it

48: i don't believe there is a max number of a zeds a building can have (or adjacent), if there was the concept of zombie zoos wouldn't work, (unless that table was about max zombies on day 1 in which case disregard my answer here )

I guess I'll ask the obvious, but still very important question. Q63 What's new for season 10?
On september 22, 2014
drakh

Gameplay updates! : The attacks will be even more violent this season... No mercy from the very first day. Less immunity for the cowards who hide under their beds.
Simplification of the Non-Distant Regions. :
a few less zombies.
buildings are further away (distance = 3).
no dead-heads near the town.
no advanced ruins (explorable).
reduced number of buildings.
no camping.
Evolution for the heroes :

Become a Pro-Watchman and increase you chances of surving a watch.
Updated help :

We've dusted of the help section of the game and updated it so as to make it your go to guide for surviving in the outer-world (uf yo notice any errors report it to your mods, they know what to do...)
New texts to find :

The chronicals of Die2Nite get even thicker with a good dozen more chapters to find.
New titles to unlock :

The titles for your miraculous achievements hae been stacked on... Will you be able to climb to the top of the new pile?
Loads of little bug fixes and calibrations :
Watches: We've added the idea of caccumulated fatigue. You lose 10% chance of survial with every night spent on lookout. You recover 5% with every night you rest.
The return of Defensive Objects as an alternative for defence. Defensive focus offers the best conversion rate over 5 evolutions.
Terrified? you'll find it harder to recover nowadays. (showers are less effective for a example).
Worksite architecture evolves.
Theft from the bank is back in Pandemonium (same rules in Distant Regions).
Adjustments on worksites (no details here because it could change).
correction of the Architects Chest in the Non-Distant Regions which bugged out occasionally
Improvements and corrections in the logs of watchmen
Reusing Earplugs willnow reduce terror (Effect non-accumulable).

MikiQ70: Do you come back to resident after or before the attack, if you have been BiA'ed?

On october 5, 2014
Dream
Inspiration for the people
tooophartQ71:
How do you autosearch

A71:

i made this post in my MMJ town so why not here as well.

scavenging:
few people not fully familiar with optimal organized play should read this because you are scavenging in wrong zones:
befor your town gets watchtower upgraded to level 5 and with it teleport from 3km range your max autosearching range must be 9 AP

after getting teleport:
all scavengers must go straight to a picked 11 or 10 AP ranged zone to Autosearch there all day long till it depletes. this means autosearching in any zone like 6, 7, 8 or 9 AP range is wrong.

here is why

in random towns or less organized towns where there are only 10 people max who go out autosearching inside 6 AP range, it is a good idea because there isnt enough people to deplete them all,

BUT in an organized town like this one where at least 20 people go scavenge daily, all zones inside 9 AP range will eventualy get depleted by all those 20 scavengers going to their 11 AP ranged zone and back, so outosearching close to town is basicly wasting autosearches and items from 11 AP and 10 AP range.

by avoiding this we get the optimal 100% max out of the desert.

and later when we build Searchtower we will do the same aim to go to all 11 , 10 and 9 AP ranges and the 8, 7 and 6 AP ranged zones will get depleted by walking through them eventualy.

i hope this clears it and get the idea crossed.

  • in towns without zed control in them make sure to go scavenge with a partner or a group with enough Control points to avoid getting trapped. and if you go alone take enough weapons with you to not end up having to ask for help after getting trapped.
    Also just for a refresher:

To go 11 ap away, you need to use 6ap base, 7ap food, and water (19 ap trip)

If you have 7ap start then 6ap food works but as long as we have plenty of 7ap food then use 7ap food anyway for extra AP in town

Make sure to return on a corner teleport (1/-2, 1/2, 2/1, 2/-1). If you come back on a 0 line you will be 1 ap short.

You just need to be careful when tasting rations with a cooler - if you have a ration you want to test in your inventory and use the cooler, a normal ration will be dumped in the cooler unless it's full, but if the ration is poisoned you will actually drink from the cooler!

thee is a PROTOCOL for knowing exactly when a ruin is depleted:

  • you ask all ruin runners to report their exact findings fron the 10 doors daily from each ruin (so in HC you need 2 of those threads for reporting results)
  • the second you get 2 ruin runs in a row where both have gotten exactly 10 empty searches from all 10 doors , then you can call the ruin depleted and there is NOTHING more to get out of it

and to second question : yes in wonder town hunts in HC the best way to get wonders is to use almost your entire Heroic Returns by all Heroes and BiA Residents to walk most zones in the entire map till you find both Sealed Arch chests.

scouts and BiA scouts are most useful for this kind of hunt for SACs

Camping chances calculator 1

Camping chances calculator 2

and NO in die2nite there is no such thing called night maule or night penalty (daylight from 7.00 til 19.00)
camping in d2n at any hour during the full 24 hours daily always gives you the same camping chances.

in hordes you get 10% bonus if you camp during the night from 19.00 til 7.00 ish

otherwise rest of chances ARE identical in both servers

On november 10, 2015
Ivana
Karima_Kuzuki

i wanna ask something...

What happens if you are ever hurt by a zombie? Do you get infected?

You can get hurt by zombie if you flee from zone or you are on watch and get injured while defending your town (or if someone punch you- I hope that is not the case). When you get injured, that day you don't have infection, that day you just have injury. If you don't heal it by next attack you will get infected after attack and still have your injury since it's not healed. Peracetoid or shaman can heal infection, but not injury, you still need to find bandage to heal fully. Otherwise you will just get infected again after next attack.

On november 16, 2015
Neuroguy
kingoo1What's a zoo/half-zoo?? I saw many people talk about getting zoos, and I think like knowing what it is would improve my teamwork abilities (which are currently nearly non-existent)

A "zoo" is where you kill off all zeds on the map save for one quadrant and keep them contained there, such as this example.

If you can accomplish and maintain this, then it allows everyone to roam around most of the map much easier, and it makes getting to more end-game camping spots much easier.

On january 15, 2016
Dream
Inspiration for the people

Yes it is rare but that does not mean 100% that the NE is zed-free. In such maps where the distribution of buildings in the map is imbalanced the game balance things out by generating zombies in the buildings-free quarter in spite not having a building there.
In your case of trying to build a zoo you still have to scout the NE quarter to be sure if you don't want to take any risks..

I have seen zeds without buildings in 3 maps before. UFC season 9. Hippie town season 10. And I was shown a map by unnamed meta with such case.

I would say the chance of not having solo zed without buildings in imbalaced maps is 50%. So if you don't check it and the other side of the coin is winning you know what is coming.

Inspiration for the people

On march 15, 2016
valer

If you stop playing, it generally takes three days before you die. The first day you're OK, second day you're thirsty, third day dehydrated and fourth day dead. That's why people who join a town with a coalition, but never log in, die during the attack before the fourth day.

If you're thirsty but refreshed before the attack, you'll wake up thirsty (not dehydrated).

On march 26, 2016
Sashimi

DST screwing up AS is not true.

Day light savings screws up the AS timer, BUT you still AS and find and drop items just like normal.

The timer will be all screwy - but you will find items, deplete zones, or finding nothing along the normal time frame
On march 29, 2016
valer

The main problem with DST is that North America has different start and end dates than EU (and hence the game). Other countries have their own completely different dates and I think most of the world doesn't have DST any more. If someone were to invent daylight saving time today, they would be ridiculed and thought of as a mad person, but most people wouldn't pay attention at all.

On march 30, 2016
Ivana
valerThe situation of a BiA'd resident is equivalent to a player who's on the last day of their bought hero time. So yes, the last day (which is also the first in the case of BiA) counts fully in all respects.

Well.. not fully true. You do get defense and all bonuses visible when you join the watch. But as soon as day has ended, you stop having all bonuses from it. So if it's your last day as a hero or just BiA day, you will lose your defense and all bonuses as soon as attack starts. It's different with surv class cause camping chances are locked before attack starts (by pressing a hide button before ofc). But you can't lock watch chances. As soon as a day has ended (23:00h) you lose your chances as a guardian and all bonus defense you were bringing with you.

Some of us learned on the hard way :x

On april 1, 2016
Dream
Inspiration for the people
ForgottenWill a Bia'd guardian get their defence bonus on the watch?

first i thank both answers above , but i have to correct both since the answers are incomplete.

a BiA Guardian or a Hero guardian on last hero day:
here are the things which will happen on that day BiA/last hero day:

  • the guardian adds 5 permanent defence to the town from the shield and this Permanent defence will count for the total town defence and will never disappear prior to attack and when the attack takes place this 5 defence will count.
  • the Guardian adds 10 permanent defence to the town if GUARD TOWER is built and will also NOT disappear prior to attack no matter what.
  • If Guard Tower is built the BiA/last hero day Guardian can organize 10 temporary defence which counts towards the total town defence and also this 10 defence will not disappear prior to attack if the guardian loses hero status.
  • if the guardian is on watch that night he will keep the 4% safety bonus AND the 30 watch points from the shield which count when the attack takes place.
    • HOWEVER the guardian who gains a 5th place in rucksack from hero status will lose this slot prior to attack and with it lose the watch points from the item he is currently carrying in his exact 5th slot in rucksack. if for example that item happen to be a guitar then the watch will have 19 less watch points from that guardian, if he will be carrying only 4 items then noting will be lost. if that guardian has the ability "place for everyting" which gives a 6th additional place in rucksack then the item in the 6th slot in rucksack will also not count on watch and its points will be subtracted from the total watch points of that guardian and the watc and town defence in total.
    • and last case the guardian will lose the 1 personal home defence point provided by the hero status. BUT will keep the 1 home def point provided by the guardian shield. so if zeds make it through the gates and 2 zeds attack that BiA guardian he will lose his hero stats 1 additional home def point and keep the 1 from shield and with that die attacked by 1 zed.

in short : all bonuses provided by the shield of the guardian remain prior and when the attack takes place. but the bonuses from hero status will disappear.

all tested and confirmed from several cases when attacks were covered fully by watchmen BiA guardians but specific zed numbers (the items placed in 5th and 6th slot) made it through and attacked citizens.

Refreshing the browser is a bad idea, as you will become kicked out and injured, since Flash didn't tell MT servers that you exited properly the ruin from the initial entrance event.

for like 10-15 seconds, then eventually it made it back.

and go on http://twinoid.com
or the forum page http://www.die2nite.com/tid/forum
and see if connectivity recovers.

http://www.die2nite.com/

In most MT games, if you reload the Flash page,
you lose your current life / unsaved game:

etc.

Dream
Inspiration for the people
goobSo "improvements".....not topology rating?

first of all you can ignore the messages you read in each zone and after each upgrade because those do not help much compared to the real calculating which the camping calculater does.

as you know empty zones has 0 topology which means 0%
and buildings can have different topologies from 1 to 15
each of those numbers is 5% camping odds .
so the building which has 1 topology gives 5% survival camping odds. nuclear bunker with 15 topology gives 15 which is 15 x 5% = 75% survival camping odds.

if you know this you can completely ignore the texts you read in zones after you perform upgrades and just read and learn the following: (this means you can know your exact camping chances at any zone in the world beyond even before going there while you are still in town thinking about camping)



Campsite Upgrading Guide:

this is for all who may not know how upgrading works Optimally:

always use the Camping Calculator
or this other more complicated Camping Calculator

each campsite can be upgraded 10 upgrades to reach maximum, and from those 10 upgrades 3 upgrades get lost each new day and only 7 upgrades remain stored in this campsite for the next day.

now about DO (Defensive Objects) Installs:
we can only install DOs only if the campsite has 9.9 or less upgrades stored, and to make sure to reach the maximum possible installing DOs always must come last after normal upgrades: we have 2 possible variation for DO Installs:

  • either making total 9 upgrades including the upgrades stored from previous days then install a DO to reach 9 + 1.8 = 10.8 (this counts as 11 in the calculator)
  • or making total 8 upgrades including the upgrades stored from previous days then install 2 DO in a row.
    • first 8 upgrades + first DO which is 8 + 1.8 = 9.8 (this counts as 10 in the calculator)
    • then install second DO which is 9.8 + 1.8 = 11.6 (this counts as 12 in the calculator)

NOW Upgrading next day after installing DOs in previos days:

  • if you did 9 upgrades + installed 1 DO yesterday then campsite had 10.8 yesterday, and 3 get lost the next day which means the campsite has now 10.8 - 3 = 7.8 stored.
    SO from now on all you can do to reach the max is:
    • no upgrades AT ALL
    • first DO install to reach 7.8 + 1.8 = 9.6 then
    • second DO install to reach 9.6 + 1.8 = 11.4
  • if you did 8 upgrades + installed 2 DO yesterday then campsite had 11.6 yesterday, and 3 get lost the next day which means the campsite has now 11.6 - 3 = 8.6 stored.
    SO from now on all you can do to reach the max is:
    • 1 normal upgrade to reach 8.6 + 1 = 9.6
    • 1 x DO install to reach 9.6 + 1.8 = 11.4



ALL remember the Order of camping with others in same campsite:

  • First Camper gets 0% penalty
  • Second Camper gets 0% penalty
  • Third Camper gets 10% penalty
  • 4th Camper gets 30% penalty
  • 5th Camper gets 50% penalty



this is pretty much all needed to know how to reach the max of upgrades needed when penalties start to reduce our chances to get 90%



to answer your first question. campsites which have 1 or 2 or 3 upgrades stored today will have zero upgrades stored next day. you can think about campsite upgrades as a glass of water which has 10 drops in it and each day 3 drops dry out , if there was 1 or 2 drops then next day the glass becomes empty.

Dream
Inspiration for the people
Too_TonIs there any harm in farming for distinctions in small towns over distant towns? I feel that honestly I'd get away with getting LMS and stuff much easier. What do you guys think?

small towns are for newbies under 100 soul points who are starting to like this game and learn about itÂ´s basics.
if a pro comes to small towns and turn on selfish mode and not even bother to guide or teach or be a team player (which is all required to fight for distinctions), then most of the newbies will get the impression that this game is unfair or harsh and may decide to quit before they got the chance to see large maps or HC which could be more fun and exciting than small maps and give someone a reason to like this game and give it a serious shot.

so my advice would be to avoid playing anything against team play in small maps for the sake of the future of the game. but no one can and should stop you , there is no rule that forbids it.

Miudo

If they did they would have a different icon or some sort of identification.

An Uncommon Blueprint found on a Worn bag is the same as the one found by camping any ruin near town and the same as the ones received by Architect Study.

In other words: They unlock any construction for that rarity pool, regardless what their origin was.

On july 27, 2016
Beakerrr

Q: Does the type of Town (i.e Small, Distant, HC) affect the speed the hero perk bar fills up?
On july 28, 2016
Miudo
Tha dance of the ducks

Technically they are all the same, but in practice you will see a Hero amassing more days if he/she plays on Small Map towns if compared to the big map towns.

The reason for that is simple because Hardcore and Distant Region maps usually take more than a day to fill nowadays. This result on an extended day 1, which, on its turn, make the filling of the Hero days bar slower.

thewolf66

^^^
About question 3: So here is how zombies spawn.
On d1 they spawn near ruins, or on random places.
After that for every zone that is near a zone with zombies there is a chance of x zombies spawning in that zone which may or may not decrese depending on the number of zombies in that zone already. How big is x depends on the number of zombies nearby.(It is stated that x=number of zones with zombies nearby, but thats not true according to my observations)
For every 2 zombies killed in a zone one will die fro desparation during the attack. If you hava a zone with 12 zeds in it and kill 8, the remaining 4 will die from desparation during the attack. Most likely new will spawn on their place.
Global respawn(quote from the wiki):
Global Respawn is the situation where zombies will respawn across the entire map randomly if the total population drops below a certain threshold. It is a measure which prevents the elimination of zombies in the Small world.gif World Beyond.
In Season 1, it is suggested that if the population of the zombies falls under the following threshold, it will trigger global respawn.
Threshold = Day number x Map width Ã 2
However things have changed after some season. The exact formula is not yet discovered. The current threshold is higher than that of Season 1, so it is advised you add some safety margin to the formula. Some suggest adding 5 to the map width, or multiply the answer by 110%.

The French wiki says this:
Zone vide isolÃ©e : une zone vide situÃ©e au milieu d'autres zones vides ne reÃ§oit pas de zombies pendant la nuit, exceptÃ© lors d'une repopulation massive (cf. ci-dessous)
Zone vide : une zone vide reÃ§oit de 0 Ã  4 zombies par soir. Ce tirage ne dÃ©pend pas du nombre de zombies proches, mais du nombre de zones adjacentes occupÃ©es. La moyenne semble Ãªtre de un zombie supplÃ©mentaire par zone adjacente occupÃ©e mais c'est alÃ©atoire.
Zone occupÃ©e une zone occupÃ©e reÃ§oit en moyenne entre 1 et 2 zombies (assez proche de un par jour).

Translation:
Isolated empty zone (no zeds in surrounding zones) will gain no zombies overnight, except during massive repop.
Empty zone with populated adjacent zones will gain 0-4 zombies overnight. This number does not depend on the number of zombies nearby, but on the number of adjacent zones populated. The average seems to be [number of adjacent populated zones] +1, but it is random.
This seems to fit my experience above.
Occupied zone receives on average around 1-2 zombies per night (almost only one per day).

here is an old answer to this question:
Here

  • so basiclly if you have a zone that is zed free and completely surrounded with 8 adjacent zones full of zeds then theoretically there could be 8 zeds there over night, (but only theoretically) if there are only 4 adjacent zones to it then next day you could get 4 zeds.
    from my experience there is however a limit to the spread to a completely zed-free zone, and that is 4 or 5 max. BUT the reason for that is that each zed infested zone has an X% chance to either
    • not spread at all (very low)
    • Spread inside itself (no adjacent zone will get spread from it)
    • Spread into one of the total 8 adjacent zones around it (special cases when the zone is next to one of the map borders)

those are the reasons why we never see more than 3 to 4
new zombies spread over night in a zed free zone. its because there are soo many other possibilities and direction each zone could spread its zeds to and there is very low chances that all adjacent zones would spread into one direction. in fact i believe the code has a max limit if spread set at 5 per zone
and also keep in mind it is still Random Number Generator so it is totally random if all or some or even none of the adjacent zones will cause a spread and simply spread inside their zone.

it was confirmed when you go open a path to a campsite and kill down to zero and in 2 days you go back on the same path (2 days because on the first day most of the zeds which will spread from outside the zone will die from deep stored grief (attrition), but the day the stored grief is gone that zone will be surrounded with at least 7 adjacent zones full of zeds. and the adds of finding less than 3 zeds there is very low) (4 was confirmed 100% in d2n, no one reported 5 though in d2n, idk about hordes)

  • about zeds dying from grief (Attrition): for each 2 zeds you kill in each zone one zed left in that zone will die from grief. BUT Spread happens ALWAYS before Grief (Attrition) , SO that zed could spread to adjacent zones first then die from grief.
  • AND the Exception of the Rule (100% tested and confirmed) is:
    a zone that has at least one zed in it and completely surrounded with 8 other adjacent zones which all are zeds infested, can only get 1 additional zed over night.
    i believe this is an exception to minimize the zed numbers and prevent them from becoming impossible numbers compared to the number of weapons the game provides.

On november 18, 2016
Dream
Inspiration for the people

this table is oversimplifying it that you dont have to calculate at all: BUT it is 100% accurate.

it shows you that when you have 4 zeds in a zone and you kill 3 of them 1 die from grief because there is only one zed left in the zone to die.

if the zone has 6 zeds , the table tells you to kill 5 to get rid of all next day, because that is the only way to be 100% sure the left over zeds alive will die next day without spreading enough new zeds to remain alive next day.
the reason you can not leave 2 alive and kill only 4 in a zone of 6 is that the 2 zeds you will leave alive WILL FIRST spread THEN die from grief , so the 2 become 3 or 4 then the 2 die, and you are left with 1 to 2 new born zombies next day.

i would surely not look to the table each time its needed and instead only count on one Rule:
for each 2 you kill, a 3rd dies next day AFTER it gets a chance to spread. so the only way to be sure you kill all zeds present in a zone and have it empty next day is to kill one more than you should according to the Rule.

Miudo
Tha dance of the ducks

A6: Yes, it just won't show what your odds will be if you decide to Look for a Tomb. Those will appear after you are hidden.

A7: Chaos Mode doesn't affect camping. Town Devastation does. It gives -50% penalty on camping.

A8: The zone downgrades 3 times, which is -5% each for a -15% total.

A9: Uh ... no.

Multi-night camping works (in %) like this for normal people:
-20/-20 2nd Night (Normal/HC)
-45/-30 3rd Night (Normal/HC)
-65/-40 4th Night (Normal/HC)
-80/-50 5th Night (Normal/HC)
...and this for Pro-Camper:
-10/-5 2nd Night Pro (Normal/HC)
-20/-10 3rd Night Pro (Normal/HC)
-40/-20 4th Night Pro (Normal/HC)
-50/-30 5th Night Pro (Normal/HC)
-65/-40 6th Night Pro (Normal/HC)
-80/-50 7th Night Pro (Normal/HC)

I'd need to know more data about your specific scenario to be able to help you there, I don't know where are you camping (distance, topology) and some other stuff.

A10: There seems to be some insidious bug related to the loss of Control Points by the Desert Guide. If you check the Bug reports thread you will notice several reports and maybe find something that resembles what you experienced there.

A11: As far as I know our old meta camping sheet is still fairly accurate. I don't see any issues with the camping sheet you linked (7sins?) and since you know french you might enjoy this other thing.

Camping is one of the things that haven't changed much for quite some time, so even old sheets aren't that inaccurate (unless people vandalized it).

A12: Radius Radar beacon (and its mk2 version) will reveal the neighbor zones but they won't tell you if they are depleted or how many zombies are there exactly.

Imagine it as a mini-watchtower that was just built where you are. There you go.

matsuuu

A7.2: How many campers there was, 3rd and later campers get some camping penalty so that may be one thing that affected.

A8.2: You can upgrade it 3 times, if it was last night 10 upgrades.
BUT, installing DO's gives 1.8 upgrades to zone, so upgrading zone once and installing 2 DO's gives 11,6 total, and again during night you loose 3, and you will have only 8,6 upgrades, and then you can only upgrade it 2 times. So if you have installed DO's amount of upgrades you can do on next day varies, but if you only do normal upgrades, you can always upgrade it 3 times, until total amount is at 10.

Q12.2: On FDTD and on game's map. Just as Miudo said, it's like mini-watchtower, it give every same information as watchtower upgrades.

I was talking this calculator, https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/... and I also sometimes use this: http://astrotools.free.fr/d2n/index.php that is english version of that one Miudo posted. I don't know are they totally accurate but works fine for my purposes.

Miudo
Tha dance of the ducks

Shun distinctions you mean? Or the act of shunning itself?

Shunning distinctions might indicate that the player you are dealing with might be troublemaker, but it doesn't always work like that. Some players collect that distinction by simple asking to be shunned, or play on metas that use the shunned abilities to enhance their play.

Its hard to earn a lot of distinctions this way, thats why, if you take a closer look at FDTD's leaderboard for the distinction you will see that only deleted players and long-time griefers are on top.

Taking the distinction as a shunnometer, or in other words, a stain on other players soul that indicate they should be shunned again, asap, on this new town even if the player in question haven't yet committed anything shun-worthy... really depends on the town and its players actually.

Some people just don't bother checking other peoples soul. Others do that and sometimes want to shun half the town because of this distinction or the lack of that other one.

The act of shunning is another league, which I'm not debating thoroughly now as I sense its not actually what you want.

Basically it is the feature the game has where a group of people can neutralize some other player actions by voting. Sometimes the voting system is used to get advantages later on, and there are other implications, but mostly, its being used correctly. The major groups that have decided to abuse this system to get benefits and game advantages were dealt with and they are not so common.

+++
If you seek an answer to maybe try to explain WHY NO GROUP WANTS TO TEAM WITH ME FOR LONG? IS IT MY 5 SHUNS? the answer for the second question is NO.

Metas don't want a selfish player like you around. They will probably stick with you for a couple towns, but eventually they will ditch you, because you totally deserve it.

If you want to play on a meta environment, you sir, have to change your playstyle now.

You can't be on a meta town and still be selfish. You won't last in the group. Thats simple Nature rule, man.

Your past towns are also testimony of your selfish play. Some meta players often play on random towns and see how you do, exactly how you really do. That doesn't go forgotten so easily.

My advice for you is maybe change your nick and avatar, wait for a Season change (so you get your town list 'erased' ), and try again, but really make an effort to work for the town.

No longer read the Book of Calm 'accidentally' that much.
No longer ignore raffles and explain: 'oopsie daisy, missed that'
No longer hold all those souls in the chest to be the only one to purify once Hammam is up.
No longer go for LMS on meta towns, including sabotage to make sure you get it.
No longer cremate all your fellow players, totally ignoring raffle orders.

Be altruistic. If thats possible.

On may 22, 2017
JohnWasTaken

how to spot a ghoul?
On may 22, 2017
Naia

That really depends on how clever the ghoul is.

You can go to peoples houses and look at when they have last been online. Or if items have been taken / put in the bank. If someone have been eaten 14.45 and someone was last seen online at 14.47, it could be one indicator.

A ghoul don't need food or water, so people who don't take their water ration or food from the bank, could also be a indicator.

Wounds and infection. Did someone ask for help yesterday curing wounds or infection, and now they look to be healthy. If so, did they use bandage or drugs, or could that be the ghoul ?

The gazette. Look trough it carefully. Did someone eat a meaty bone on day 3 - 4 and 5, that could be someone who was trying to become a ghoul on purpose.

Change in behaviour or forum posts. Sometimes a ghoul will give themselves away. A ghoul will usually want lot's of people to scavenge a few zones away from town, so they can pick their target.
Did someone who haven't said anything on the forum yet, suddenly start making post asking for more people to go out scavenging.

Basically try to find as many indications as possible by looking at peoples actions, and when you think you know who it is, attack them and hope you was right.
Or leave them alive and make sure they eat the competition and not you, then kill them later.

A clever ghoul will try to avoid anything that can give them away,. Sometimes you will not get any clues at all and finding the ghoul will be impossible. Happy hunting.

yungching

Q3: This is a little complicated. We are out camping.

Day 5: If we do 2 upgrades + DO, and end the day with 11.4 upgrades, tomorrow (Day 6) we would be at 8.4? And thus only be able to reach 10.4 with simple upgrades?

Meaning that the 3rd DO is best installed on what you think is going to be your last day camping unless you have a 4th? Since it brings the max back down to 10.4 instead of 10.6.

Hope I didn't confuse anyone

when the campsite is at 8.4 today next day you need to perform 1 Upgrade followed by 1 DO install to get to 11.2.

and FYI next day (7) you perform 1 upgrade + DO install to make it 11. then Day 8 you can install 2 DOs again to get back to 11.6.
so the rule is: for optimal upgrades: once your campsites get passed 11.X you should never drop down to 10.X because that would only mean a misclick or a mistake.

Dreamwhen the campsite is at 8.4 today next day you need to perform 1 Upgrade followed by 1 DO install to get to 11.2.

and FYI next day (7) you perform 1 upgrade + DO install to make it 11. then Day 8 you can install 2 DOs again to get back to 11.6.

so the rule is: for optimal upgrades: once your campsites get passed 11.X you should never drop down to 10.X because that would only mean a misclick or a mistake.

Sorry I should have made it clearer, we only had a total of 3DOs, and only had one left by Day 5.

So my question was about when you should install the last DO you have at your campsite.

Day 5 we started with 7.6 upgrades.

So if I understand right, there could have been two scenarios:

Day 5: 7.6 + Upgrade twice + DO = 11.4
Day 6: 8.4 + Upgrade twice = 10.4

or

Day 5: 7.6 + Upgrade 3 times = 10.6
Day 6: 7.6 + Upgrade twice + DO = 11.4

I was worried I might have miscalculated somewhere since I don't remember people ever discussing about the cons of installing a 3rd DO.

But you seem to have confirmed that starting from the 3rd DO the digit after the decimal does indeed decrease (.4 .2 .0) before if can increase back to .6

So I guess the opportunity just doesn't arise often enough for it to be discussed or be important

yungching

Sorry I should have made it clearer, we only had a total of 3DOs, and only had one left by Day 5.

So my question was about when you should install the last DO you have at your campsite.

the answer to this question is always checking your camping chances in the camping calculator to see exactly how close you and all campers with you are to 90%

if you can guarantee that all campers with you get at least 90% including you (90+ to 100% for survivalists) then it will be highly recommended NOT to install any DOs at all early and delay it for next day when your chances drop down below 90% and installing a DO will give you those extra 4% you badly need.

and in my experience that extra 1% always matters when the camping odds are below 90%. so the later you use DOs the better. in fact this is the key to increase the shot at surviving your 9th and 10th camp in one town (in an optimal nuclear bunker with few camp gears) once you make campsite go back to 11.0 at the exact day when the extra 3% (0.6) is badly needed (when camping odds are 55% ish and next day 35% ish)

SaranCan we have infected status as a ghoul?

according to the wiki NO

Any statuses like Hooked!, Drugged, Drunk, and Hungover will be passed over from the victim to the Ghoul.

No risk of death from Dehydration or Infection.

Cannot become Status Thirsty, Status Dehydrated! or Status Infected.
